conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each source point and how it interacts with the baffles.
Liquid flows downward due to gravity.
Baffles will redirect the flow based on their orientation.
Liquid from source A flows down and encounters the yellow baffle.
Yellow baffle redirects the flow to the right.
Flow from source A continues down and encounters the orange baffle.
Orange baffle redirects the flow further to the right.
Flow from source A continues down and is directed towards container F.
Liquid from source B flows down and encounters the green baffle.
Green baffle redirects the flow to the right.
Flow from source B continues down and encounters the gray baffle.
Gray baffle redirects the flow further to the right.
Flow from source B continues down and is directed towards container F.
Liquid from source C flows down and encounters the cyan baffle.
Cyan baffle redirects the flow to the left.
Flow from source C continues down and encounters the gray baffle.
Gray baffle redirects the flow further to the left.
Flow from source C continues down and is directed towards container E.
Liquid from source D flows down and encounters the cyan baffle.
Cyan baffle redirects the flow to the left.
Flow from source D continues down and encounters the gray baffle.
Gray baffle redirects the flow further to the left.
Flow from source D continues down and is directed towards container E.
Sources A and B direct the liquid to container F.
Sources C and D direct the liquid to container E.
